intro: Doritis deliciosa, commonly known as the "Coral Cactus," is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant features a short, branching stem covered in dense, woolly leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are typically bright yellow or orange, appearing in clusters during the warmer months. Doritis deliciosa is well adapted to harsh, dry environments and requires minimal water once established.
